panels.description:
Information about the charon cluster.

- **Network**: The blockchain network 
- **Operators/Nodes**: The number of operators or nodes or peers in the charon DV cluster.
- **Threshold**: The minimum number of participating nodes (also quorum).
- **Validators**: The number of validators added to the cluster, each validator is staking 32 ETH.

targets.expr:
( 1 * avg(app_version{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash", cluster_network="mainnet"}) )
or 
( 2 * avg(app_version{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash", cluster_network="goerli"}) )
or
( 3 * avg(app_version{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash", cluster_network="sepolia"}) )
or
( 4 * avg(app_version{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash", cluster_network="gnosis"}) )

panels.title: Cluster Info

panels.description: Successful cluster duty percentage by type over the whole time range
panels.title: Cluster Duty Success(%)

panels.description: Status returned from the `/readyz` health status endpoint. Unhealthy reasons include beacon node problems, charon p2p problems, or validator client problems.
panels.title: Health Status

panels.description:
This panels shows any health checks that are failing. See <add link> for help troubleshooting.  

Note the different severities:
- **info**: Only informational, might not be an actual problem.
- **warning**: Performance is degraded, operator intervention only required if this persists for a long time.
- **critical**: Significant problem, validators probably not operation at all. Immediate operator intervention required.
panels.title: Failing Health Checks

panels.description:
- **Peer**: The peer's name (inferred from their *charon-enr-private-key*)
- **You**: ‚≠êÔ∏è is this local charon node
- **Connected**: Whether you are currently connected to this peer.
- **Direct**: Whether the connection is *direct* (üëç) or *relay* (üëé) 
- **Latency**: The time messages take to travel to/from the peer.
- **Version**: The version of the peer's charon node
- **Supported**: Whether the peers charon version is supported/compatible or not.
- **Uptime**" The duration since peer was restarted.
- **üößAttest**: Number of attestation duties missed in the time window.
- **üößPropose**: Number of block proposal duties missed in the time window.
- **üößOther**: Number of other duties missed in the time window.

targets.expr:
(
    sum(increase(core_tracker_participation_missed_total{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash", duty="attester"}[$__range])) by (peer) 
/
    sum(increase(core_tracker_participation_expected_total{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash", duty="attester"}[$__range])) by (peer) 
) OR on() vector(0)

(
    sum(increase(core_tracker_participation_missed_total{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash", duty=~".*proposer"}[$__range])) by (peer) 
/
    sum(increase(core_tracker_participation_expected_total{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash", duty=~".*proposer"}[$__range])) by (peer) 
) OR on() vector(0)

(
    sum(increase(core_tracker_participation_missed_total{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash", duty="sync_message"}[$__range])) by (peer) 
/
    sum(increase(core_tracker_participation_expected_total{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash", duty="sync_message"}[$__range])) by (peer) 
) OR on() vector(0)

panels.title: Peer Connectivity and Missed Duties (üöß)

panels.description: Status returned from the `/readyz` health status endpoint. Unhealthy reasons include beacon node problems, charon p2p problems, or validator client problems.
panels.title: Historical Health Status

panels.description: Latest Charon version and git commit hash
panels.title: Versions and Git Hashes

panels.description:
Status and balance of each validator by public key with links to beaconcha.in.

If present, the "‚ùóÔ∏èPeer Exits" column indicate the number of peers that submitted partially signed exits for each validator.
panels.title: Validators

panels.description: Number of charon nodes running particular consensus client versions
panels.title: Beacon Node Version

panels.description: A 2D view of whether the connection between peers is direct or relay and quic or tcp

targets.expr:
# Create a base vector with all possible (cluster_peer, peer) combinations
(
  # Get all unique peer combinations from any connection type
  (max(p2p_peer_connection_types{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash"}) by (cluster_peer,peer) * 0) +
  
  # Add QUIC direct connections (1000 points)
  (max(p2p_peer_connection_types{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash", type="direct", protocol="quic"}) by (cluster_peer,peer) * 1000 or 
   max(p2p_peer_connection_types{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash"}) by (cluster_peer,peer) * 0) +
  
  # Add TCP direct connections (100 points)  
  (max(p2p_peer_connection_types{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash", type="direct", protocol="tcp"}) by (cluster_peer,peer) * 100 or
   max(p2p_peer_connection_types{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash", type="direct"}) by (cluster_peer,peer) * 100 or  # Fallback for old clusters
   max(p2p_peer_connection_types{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash"}) by (cluster_peer,peer) * 0) +
  
  # Add QUIC relay connections (10 points)
  (max(p2p_peer_connection_types{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash", type="relay", protocol="quic"}) by (cluster_peer,peer) * 10 or 
   max(p2p_peer_connection_types{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash"}) by (cluster_peer,peer) * 0) +
  
  # Add TCP relay connections (1 point)
  (max(p2p_peer_connection_types{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash", type="relay", protocol="tcp"}) by (cluster_peer,peer) * 1 or
   max(p2p_peer_connection_types{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash", type="relay"}) by (cluster_peer,peer) * 1 or  # Fallback for old clusters  
   max(p2p_peer_connection_types{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash"}) by (cluster_peer,peer) * 0)
)

panels.title: Peer Connection Types - direct or relay and quic or tcp

panels.description: A two dimensional view of 90th percentile latencies between peers that report to us and their cluster operators.
panels.title: Peer latencies 2D

panels.description:
Type of connections to each peer in the cluster during the time window:
 - üü¢ Green: Direct connection (this is the preferred)
 - üü° Yellow: Indirect relay connection (this is ok if only temporary)
 - üî¥ Red: No connection to peer (this is a problem)

See https://docs.obol.tech/docs/charon/networking#external-p2p-network
panels.title: Peer Connections (üü¢=direct, üü°=relay, üî¥=not connected)

panels.description: Completed duties by type over time.
panels.title: ‚úÖ Completed duties by type

panels.description: Failed duties percentage by type over time
panels.title: ‚ùå Failed duty percentage by type (per $interval)

panels.description:
Failed duties by type over time. Use data link to show logs.
Proposer duties are non-failing after being successfully included on-chain.
Other broadcasted to the beacon node duties (i.e.: attester), are non-failing after being successfully broadcasted.
Any other duties not broadcasted to the beacon node (i.e.: randao), are non-failing after consensus is reached.
panels.title: ‚ùå Failed duties by type (per $interval)

panels.description: Which operators are having a growing number of relay registrations failures, indicating there may be a risk to an upcoming MEV block production opportunity. Be conscious that absence of an operator from this list may mean their MEV registration is working, or it may mean it is not enabled at all and thus not failing.
panels.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è MEV Relay Submit Registrations Failure Growth by Operator

panels.description: The number of consensus rounds it takes to achieve consensus on a batch of duties. When every node is online, this should be 1 round, if it is taking more rounds than the fault tolerance of the cluster to come to consensus, there may be an issue with node operators in the cluster, or the latency of the cluster.
panels.title: Consensus Rounds: $duty

panels.description: How long in total did it take to come to consensus on this/these duties? Duties generally have a 4 second window to be completed (1.25s on gnosis chain), so consensus should not take more than half of that time for good performance.
panels.title: Consensus duration: $duty
